title: a sans serif font; look at the bottom of the second image
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162204im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fontid_6476.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162204im_/http:/typophile.com/files/website-header_5863.jpg)

The same image is also available at centralseminary.edu in the header image

Font: 

 Candara 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162204/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

author: roryjasonmartin

comments.content: Please help me find the bottom font on this image. I need it to create a high resolution duplicate, but no one currently at the organization can identify it, or knows who created it.

I believe its Candara, which came bundled with the Microsoft Windows OS starting in 2008:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/candara/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162204/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/candara/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/candara/")

Works reasonably well with Trajan....

It seems the designer of the logo used fake small caps, though Candara includes small caps.  
 [http://myfonts.us/td-UQWPNh](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162204/http:/myfonts.us/td-UQWPNh "http://myfonts.us/td-UQWPNh")
Thank you so much for your help. You both have saved me a lot of time and trouble.
